text: Konstantin Rodofinikin(1760-1838) Konstantin Rodofinikin (; 1760–1838), contemporarily known simply as Rodophinikin, was a Russian diplomat, agent in Revolutionary Serbia (1807–13), and member of the State Council. He was Greek, born on Rhodes. He served in the military, joining the Pereyaslav Cossack regiment in 1783, and then entered the Collegium of Commerce in 1786. ==References== * * Category:Imperial Russian diplomats Category:Imperial Russian politicians Category:19th-century Russian people Category:People of the Serbian Revolution Category:Russian people of Greek descent Category:People from Rhodes Category:Greek emigrants to Russia Category:Greeks of the Ottoman Empire Category:1760 births Category:1838 deaths Category:Burials at the Dukhovskaya Church
title: Konstantin Rodofinikin
